00002 #ifndef SUDOKUH
00003 #define SUDOKUH
00004 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00005 
00006 class Sudoku
00007 {
00008   public:
00009       // Used by the callback function 
00010     enum MessageType
00011     {
00012       MSG_STARTING,      // the board is setup, ready to go
00013       MSG_FINISHED_OK,   // finished and found a solution
00014       MSG_FINISHED_FAIL, // finished but no solution found
00015       MSG_ABORT_CHECK,   // checking to see if algorithm should continue
00016       MSG_PLACING,       // placing a symbol on the board
00017       MSG_REMOVING       // removing a symbol (back-tracking)
00018     };
00019 
00020       // 1-9 for 9x9, A-P for 16x16, A-Y for 25x25
00021     enum SymbolType {SYM_NUMBER, SYM_LETTER};
00022 
00023     const static char EMPTY_CHAR = ' ';
00024 
00025       // Implemented in the client and called during the search for a solution
00026     typedef bool (*SUDOKU_CALLBACK)
00027       (const Sudoku& sudoku, // the gameboard object itself
00028        const char *board,    // one-dimensional array of symbols
00029        MessageType message,  // type of message
00030        size_t move,          // the move number
00031        int basesize,         // 3, 4, 5, etc. (for 9x9, 16x16, 25x25, etc.)
00032        int index,            // index of current cell
00033        char value,           // symbol (value) in current cell
00034        int *dup_indexes      // index of each duplicate sorted from lowest
00035                              // index to highest. -1 means no conflict.
00036                              // max of 3 duplicates.
00037       );
00038 
00039     struct SudokuStats
00040     {
00041       int basesize;      // 3, 4, 5, etc.
00042       int placed;        // the number of values the algorithm has placed 
00043       size_t moves;      // total number of values that have been tried
00044       size_t backtracks; // total number of times the algorithm backtracked
00045       SudokuStats() : basesize(0), placed(0), moves(0), backtracks(0) {}
00046     };
00047 
00048       // Constructor
00049     Sudoku(int basesize, SymbolType stype = SYM_NUMBER, SUDOKU_CALLBACK callback = 0);
00050 
00051       // Destructor
00052     ~Sudoku();
00053 
00054       // The client (driver) passed the board in the values parameter
00055     void SetupBoard(const char *values, int size);
00056 
00057       // Once the board is setup, this will start the search for the solution
00058     void Solve();
00059 
00060       // For debugging with the driver
00061     const char *GetBoard() const;
00062     SudokuStats GetStats() const;
00063 
00064   private:
00065     size_t moves_;
00066     SymbolType symtype;
00067     SudokuStats stats;
00068     bool solved;
00069     bool backtracking;
00070     unsigned boardlength;
00071     size_t boardmaxpos;
00072     std::string board;
00073     char firstelement;
00074     char lastelement;
00075     int dupes[3];
00076     unsigned blanks[625];
00077     CALLBACK info;
00078 
00079     void place_value(unsigned index, char value);
00080     unsigned index_to_row(unsigned index) const;
00081     unsigned index_to_col(unsigned index) const;
00082     unsigned row_col_to_index(unsigned row, unsigned col) const;
00083     bool is_in_conflict(unsigned index) const;
00084     int dupe_in_row(unsigned index) const;
00085     int dupe_in_col(unsigned index) const;
00086     int dupe_in_sqr(unsigned index) const;
00087     unsigned find_sqr_start(unsigned index) const;
00088     bool is_final_position(unsigned index) const;
00089     void update_duplicates(unsigned index);
00090     void insert_into_board(unsigned index, char value);
